block.p: The end of November revolves around turkey dinners and family get-togethers. And, to a lesser but still noticeable extent, there is a holiday tradition imported from France: the arrival of beaujolais nouveau. This fresh, fruity, two-month-old red wine from south of Burgundy arrives in Paris on the third Thursday in November, where it finds its main market among the solid, casual bistros. A selection is listed here. CAFE DE PARIS + (212) 486-1411; 924 Second Avenue, at 49th Street; $; all major credit cards

Simple, satisfying, homey fare is what this little French cafe specializes in. The limited menu features appetizers of mussels mariniere; cured salmon with dill sauce, and escargots in a sauce of Pernod and gratineed with cheese. Main courses include entrecote with the house's secret Charolaise sauce and french fries; grilled skirt steak with shallot sauce; roast chicken Basque-style, and roast rack of lamb. (Article: 11/ 3/89; revisited: 11/16/94) CAFE DES SPORTS
